medical_history.chief_complaint: Late-onset paranoid psychosis characterized by paranoid delusions and auditory hallucinations.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at age 52 with paranoid delusions, thought broadcasting, and auditory hallucinations. Symptoms improved with antipsychotic medication, and approximately 6 years after onset, the psychotic illness remitted, leading to discontinuation of all psychotropic medications. A relapse occurred shortly after release from incarceration but improved again with treatment.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of grand mal seizures between ages 15 and 29; diagnosed with granulous disease of the lungs at age 31.
medical_history.family_history: Family history includes alcohol dependence in the father, seizure disorder in one uncle, and possible dementia and depression in another uncle.
medical_history.social_history: Incarcerated for a nonviolent offense for 6 months prior to the onset of symptoms, worked various jobs including in civil service, and previously smoked and drank socially but quit at age 48.
